result.execSummary:
The defendant Codie Daniel Hayden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Codie Daniel Hayden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Codie Daniel Hayden was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Reimburse Pepin County for County Appointed Attorney Fees TBD at the rate of $100.00 per month as previously ordered.  Payments to first be applied toward County Appointed Attorney Fees then resume payments in 16CT23 until paid in full then apply payments to costs in 16CF53.
AMENDED  05-02-2017:  County Appointed Attorney Fees Ordered in the amount of $581.00 to Pepin County Clerk of Court.

Court approves expungement on the condition of completing probation with no violations.  Defendant to write the Court a letter at the end of the probation period requesting expungement for the Court's consideration.

Provide a DNA sample today at the Pepin County Jail.
Comply with any assessment or counseling set up by Probation & Parole.

Payment Plan Due Date Summary for 16CF53 (Attorney Fees) and 16CT23 (Balance owing on fine/costs)

Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty.  Ordered that $581.00 be allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements, said sums to be paid to said Atty. by Pepin County and Pepin County shall be reimbursed by defendant as previously ordered, with the defendant being credited for any sums already paid to the Pepin County Clerk of Court as part of his court-ordered attorney obligations.
Cover Letter for Invoice and Order for Fees
Invoice for Court Appointed Attorney Fees

Defendant Codie Daniel Hayden in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead to count 1, count 2 previously dismissed, 1 year probation.  Court advises defendant of charge resisting/obstructing/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of no contest.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs there are no victim impact statements.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 1 yr. probation with conditions:  provide a DNA sample today at the jail; pay costs $443.00; continue to make $100/mo. payments but apply to attorney fees TBD first in this case then resume payments in your OWI case; comply with any assessment or counseling set up by P&P; conditionally approve expungement if complete probation without any probation violations; write court letter at end of probation requesting expungement.  Advised of appeal rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Codie Daniel Hayden in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  State moves to amend count 1 to a misdemeanor, Obstructing an Officer and move to dismiss count 2.  Amendment without prejudice in the event defendant changes his mind on plea agreement.  Court amends count 1 to Obstructing an officer 946.41(1), dismiss count 2 subjection to completion of negotiations.  Referred to scheduling clerk for PLEAS date.

Adjourned initial appearance on February 7, 2017 at 09:45 am.

Ordered that Attorney Alan Morgan is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $150.00 per month continue same schedule.  
Failure to make scheduled payments without a showing by the defendant of good cause shall be contempt of court punishable under Ch. 785, Wis. Stats. and the Court shall do any of the following:  See Order
No contact with A. Spindler or K. Wittig

Defendant Codie Daniel Hayden in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties/constitutional rights.  State requests $1000 signature bond with no contact with named individuals.  Court sets $1000 Sign. Bond with condition: no contact with A. Spindler or K. Wittig;  advised defendant of right to PH w/in 20 days if not in custody. WTL for PH.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
